urls.title: Be Plant Wise - GB non-native species secretariat
urls.description: Most of us have plants in our gardens and pond s that are not native to Britain – they originally came from other parts of the world and have been introduced to Britain by people. While these non-native plants can help us to create beautiful ornamental displays to enjoy, if they escape into the wild some become invasive, harming our wildlife and environment, economy, and even our health and the way we live. But surely all plants are beneficial wherever they grow? Plants are vital for our health and

tweets.text:
#AmericanSkunkCabbage spreads rapidly with seeds that  survive up to 6 years. They stick to muddy boots so check footwear & clothing after your walks. We removed this @InvasiveSp from the Derwent catchment last year. Help stop the spread: https://t.co/irLmhhoB7e 
#PlantHealthWeek https://t.co/E7vU1km5Xe

The Hogsmill River is just one example, regularly suffering from pollution from road runoff, sewer misconnections and untreated sewage overflows. During heavy rainfall events, like the one experienced last month sewage can flow into the river from the storm tanks. https://t.co/fVIrXb0DI4
